Execution of system commands commonly us.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for command execution containing 'mount' or related keywords (Note: This log source is primarily for Windows hosts and unlikely to capture Linux mount execution directly unless specific cross-platform logging is configured). Correlate with Zeek conn.log for preceding network connections to the host where the command might have been executed.

Anomalous network traffic to/from a host.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for unusual session lengths, traffic volume, or destination ports involving hosts suspected of using bind mounts for evasion. Use statistical analysis (e.g., time series analysis, outlier detection) on network traffic metadata to identify anomalous communication patterns.

Execution of the `mount` command with bi.Action: Filter Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) logs for command lines containing 'mount' AND ('-o bind' OR '-B') AND '/proc'. Analyze the full command line to identify the source and target directories. Use frequency analysis to identify rare or first-time occurrences of such commands on specific hosts or by specific users. Look for commands executed by high-privilege accounts.

Network connections from a host suspecte.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek dns.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek ssl.log
Network connections from a host suspecte.Action: Correlate Zeek logs (conn, dns, http, ssl) from hosts suspected of using bind mounts with a list of known C2 IP addresses and domain names from cyber threat intelligence feeds. Flag connections involving these hosts that communicate with known C2 infrastructure. Use correlation analysis to identify patterns of suspicious network activity originating from these hosts.
